intro: Inocarpus glabellus, commonly known as the smooth-faced sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves adapted to store water. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the dry season. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in sandy and poor soil conditions. Inocarpus glabellus is also known for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses in treating various ailments.
